snippet: Hours after Algerian forces raided a gas facility, there was still no official word on the number of hostages freed, killed or still held by their Islamist kidnappers.
abstract: Algerian troops assault Sahara gas field facility where armed militants are holding Americans and others hostage; without warning other governments, troops free captives and kill kidnappers but also leave some hostages dead; there is no official word on number of those captured, freed or killed in raid.

byline.original: By ADAM NOSSITER and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Adam Nossiter reported from Bamako, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Reporting was contributed by Alan Cowell and Scott Sayare from Paris, Elisabeth Bumiller and John F. Burns from London, Eric Schmitt and David E. Sanger from Washington, Hiroko Tabuchi from Tokyo, and Mayy El Sheikh from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: Hours after Algerian forces raided a gas facility, there was still no official word on the number of hostages freed, killed or still held by their Islamist kidnappers.

headline.seo: Algerian Raid to Free Hostages Turns Deadly
headline.main: Algerian Troops Attack Site to End Hostage Standoff
headline.print_headline: Algerian Troops Attack Site to End Hostage Standoff
